column4: I've got modules loaded for my sound, but alsa still insists there are no soundcards.
even when the command "alsa reload" unloaded all the sound modules, then reloaded the exact same ones....
So... what the heck am I missing?
what does dmesg say?
finds that the ES1371 is there, as well as the on board AC97
snd_via82xx
I even hear clicks when I modprobe the es1371
what are you seeing that suggests alsa isn't seeing the cards ?
alsactl store; alsactl: load-state(1608):   no soundcards found
do I have to nuke asound.ctl and restart alsa?
perhaps; worth a shot
hm. Didn't work. Alsamixer still insists there's no such device (default)
Weird thing is: I've got sound devices in /dev and even a couple of control devices in /dev/snd/
... that point to two control devices in dev
weren't talking about you.. more what archboxman said
you don't have a buggered ~/.asoundrc do you
hm. Could do. I never thought of that, as I didn't know it existed until now.
you probably don't have one then
urk.
wrong damn machine.
lol.
